title: Screen-ripping 300 Hz gaming monitor crashes to just $229, touts 1440p resolution and 1ms response time   save $220 on the LG 27-inch UltraGear 27G640A-B
summary: A 1440p UltraGear monitor with a 300 Hz refresh rate is available at a lower price, offering a 1ms response time.

title: AMD's Ryzen 7 9850X3D could save you hundreds on your new build during the RAM crisis
summary: AMD's Ryzen 7 9850X3D CPU demonstrates minimal performance difference between cheap and expensive RAM, potentially saving hundreds on new builds.

title: 100W car amplifier hacked into a custom RTX 3080 heatsink custom mod slashes GPU temps by 10 C and looks absolutely stunning
summary: A Redditor replaced the RTX 3080's backplate with a massive heatsink to reduce GPU temperatures by 10°C.

title: Shopper walks out with a $4.99 Radeon RX 5700 XT GPU from Goodwill thrift stores are the hidden goldmines amid the AI-driven GPU crisis
summary: A shopper purchased a Radeon RX 5700 XT GPU for $4.99 from a Goodwill thrift store and revived it with basic maintenance for 1080p and 1440p gaming.

title: $3,000 RTX 5090 delivery brings rocks, a towel, and broken dreams unboxing nightmare on an expensive GPU bought from Amazon Resale
summary: A customer was scammed out of $3,000 when they received a box filled with rocks instead of an MSI Suprim RTX 5090.

title: Zotac reportedly cancels GPU orders and raises MSRP by $200 or more across the board the company blames 'system error' for cancellations
summary: Zotac is reportedly canceling GPU orders and increasing prices by $200 or more across its Nvidia RTX GPUs, blaming a 'system error' for the cancellations.

title: MSI MPG X870E Edge Ti Wifi Review: Silver-white aesthetic meets budget X870E
summary: MSI MPG X870E Edge Ti WiFi delivers strong performance, USB4, Wi-Fi 7, 5GbE, dual PCIe 5.0 M.2 in a stylish $299 X870E board.

title: New AI data center buildout being done in secret location to avoid backlash from local residents
summary: Applied Digital is building a 430 MW data center in a secret location to avoid publicity, citing potential 'national media attention' affecting the local town.

title: Retro gamer resurrects Nintendo Wii Food Channel, uses Wii console to order Domino s Pizza   the WiiLink project is the magic ingredient
summary: A retro gamer used a 20-year-old Nintendo Wii console to order Domino's Pizza online in the U.S. and Canada through a revived Wii Food Channel.

title: Microsoft gave customers' BitLocker encryption keys to the FBI
summary: Microsoft cooperated with the FBI, releasing a user's backup BitLocker encryption key after receiving a valid search warrant.

title: Jensen laments buying Mercedes for his parents with Nvidia stock that would be worth $1.33 billion today
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang regrets selling some of his stock to buy his parents a Mercedes Benz S-Class in 1999, which is now worth $1.33 billion.

title: Google, OpenAI, and Anthropic are competing to see whose AI can play Pokémon the best
summary: Twitch streams of AI models playing old Pokémon games have garnered hundreds of thousands of comments, testing their ability to emulate human thinking and assess risks.

title: Atari ST enthusiast announces the MiniST with FPGA, MiSTeryNano core, and black TKL case priced at around $400 each, but the initial run is a mere five units
summary: An Atari computer enthusiast is planning to produce a new FPGA-powered remake dubbed the MiniST.

title: China reveals 200-strong AI drone swarm that can be controlled by a single soldier
summary: The People's Liberation Army revealed its latest drone swarm tech with 200 units that's resistant to jamming, can make autonomous decisions, and is controlled by a single soldier.

title: Our favorite gaming headset gets a 50% price cut for a limited time Razer's BlackShark V2 Pro (2023) drops to $100
summary: Razer's BlackShark V2 Pro gaming headset has received a significant price cut, dropping to $100 for a limited time.

title: GPU price tracking 2026: Lowest price on every graphics card from Nvidia, AMD, and Intel today
summary: Check the best prices on Nvidia RTX and AMD Radeon graphics cards during the AI-driven pricing crisis.

title: Intel Q4 earnings reveal rocky path to recovery following weakest full-year revenue since 2010
summary: Intel's management stabilized the company in 2025, but the company claims it will face supply constraints in Q1 2026. Intel Foundry losses continued as 18A began ramping up, but supply challenges are expected to ease in Q2 2026.

title: Alibaba plans IPO for chip-arm T-Head to help bankroll ambitious AI infrastructure investments
summary: Alibaba's chip manufacturing business, T-head, is preparing to IPO to raise capital for its domestic AI accelerator solutions and fund infrastructure projects.

title: Nvidia reportedly cuts program designed to keep gaming GPUs near MSRP pricing
summary: Nvidia allegedly ended its OPP program that allowed board partners to sell GPUs at MSRP, which may not be good for gamers.

title: Intel says it has two prospective customers for 14A, expects to hear about commitments in second half of 2026
summary: Intel claims customers show interest in the 14A process technology, but have yet to make a commitment to use it.

title: Turtle Beach Atlas 200 Review: It sounds better than $60
summary: The Turtle Beach Atlas 200 is a budget-friendly, lightweight wired headset with surprisingly solid audio performance.

title: Grab a SteelSeries wired gaming headset for less than $20 in this Woot sale Arctis Nova 1 was $60 when it launched and is a fantastic budget option
summary: The SteelSeries Arctis Nova 1 delivers solid audio, comfort, and broad platform support, and it's now available at its lowest price ever on Woot.

title: Combat insane price rises with this Newegg 9800X3D, RAM, and X870 motherboard bundle save $269.99 over buying the parts individually
summary: Newegg's CPU, RAM, and Mobo bundle saves you $269.99, plus a free Corsair M75 wireless mouse worth $69.99

title: Lian Li RS1200G ATX 3.1 power supply review: Stellar performance, state-of-the-art design
summary: The Lian Li RS1200G ATX 3.1 offers rotational innovation and reliable performance, though case compatibility remains a legitimate concern.

title: Asus announces 'immediate internal review' of 800-series motherboards following string of 9800X3D failures
summary: Asus is investigating reports of hardware failures in its 800-series motherboards and 9800X3D processors due to user complaints.

title: Intel shares down 13% as company only manages to shrink losses in latest earnings, demand to outpace 2026 supply
summary: Intel reported flat revenue of $52.9 billion in 2025, with losses of $300 million, a significant improvement from the $18.8 billion loss in 2024, but required a $20.4 billion external investment.

title: Toilet maker Toto scores a royal flush as share price rises due to AI demand in unlikely chipmaking side-gig
summary: Toilet manufacturer Toto's shares have soared rapidly, driven by the AI memory market.

title: We can't completely vacate the client market' says Intel amid wafer supply shortages
summary: Intel is facing wafer supply shortages but won't leave the client market. Nova Lake is still on-track for release in late 2026, with 14A set for 2028.

title: Companies are deploying high-level executives abroad to keep supply chains smooth amid memory squeeze   from CEOs to procurement experts, crucial meetings across the globe shape the industry
summary: Companies are sending high-level executives abroad to secure supply chains amid a shortage, negotiating the future of the tech industry in boardrooms and restaurants.

title: Samsung refutes claims of '80% price hike' across all memory products
summary: Samsung refuted claims of an 80% price hike on all memory products, despite a messy RAM market.

title: AMD's next gaming champ to debut at $499, and you can already buy it ahead of launch
summary: AMD has confirmed that the Ryzen 7 9850X3D will hit retail on January 29 at an MSRP of $499, which is $30 more expensive than the Ryzen 7 9800X3D.

title: Xbox app is now available on all Arm-based Windows 11 devices
summary: Microsoft is making the Xbox app compatible with Arm-based processors, giving gamers more options for gaming laptops and handheld gaming PC consoles.

title: Grab an MSI 4K 144 Hz monitor for less than $200
summary: The MSI MAG 275UPD E14 delivers impressive value with dual-mode refresh rates, good color coverage, and console compatibility for $199.

title: Ubisoft's share price plummets following internal restructure announcement, pivot to heavier use of AI
summary: Ubisoft announced a massive restructuring, canceling six games and gutting several studios. The company's stock price fell to a historic low, wiping hundreds of millions off its market cap. Ubisoft's worth is now below a billion Euros.

title: Congress wants veto power over Trump administration for AI chip exports
summary: U.S. lawmakers have advanced the AI Overwatch Act, a bill that would give Congressional approval and veto power over exports of high-performance AI chips to China and other adversaries.

title: Windows Phone makes a spiritual comeback thanks to NexPhone, which can triple-boot Windows, Android, and Linux
summary: NexPhone is a three-in-one device that lets users switch between Android, Linux, and Windows 11, powered by a Qualcomm chipset with external monitor support.

title: NASA taps popular PC hardware performance tool for cockpit simulations  CapFrameX enters government software approval process
summary: NASA has started the government software approval process to use CapFrameX on its simulators to benchmark the performance of its systems.

title: Asus ROG Strix XG27AQWMG 27-inch 280 Hz OLED gaming monitor review: Premium piece and performance at a lower price point
summary: Asus brings premium OLED imagery and performance to a lower price point with the ROG Strix XG27AQWMG. It's a 27-inch QD-OLED with 280 Hz, Adaptive-Sync, HDR500 and wide gamut color.

title: Nvidia CEO expects AI to create more jobs for construction workers, electricians, plumbers, and many others
summary: Nvidia's CEO believes AI will wipe out white-collar jobs but boost demand and wages for skilled blue-collar workers due to a historic infrastructure boom.

title: SSDs now cost 16x more than HDDs due to AI supply chain crisis hybrid SSD + HDD datacenter deployments are now significantly cheaper to deploy than SSD-only equivalents
summary: A new report reveals that enterprise SSDs now cost a whopping 16x more than hard drives.

title: Customer buys ROG Astral RTX 5080, cancels order but receives GPU and $1,850 refund anyway
summary: A customer who cancelled an order for an RTX 5080 received the GPU and a $1,850 refund, and was told to keep it by Amazon. The GPU was received by a Redditor who was also given the refund money. This is considered one of the more positive Amazon delivery "fails".

title: GameStop patches 'infinite money glitch' for Nintendo Switch 2 trade-in
summary: A YouTuber exploited a loophole in GameStop's trade-in system for the Nintendo Switch 2, accumulating store credit exceeding the console's retail value. GameStop has since patched the issue. The glitch was used to get a console and games for free.

title: Chinese companies reportedly considering sourcing H200 chips from the black market as chips held at the border demand for Nvidia AI GPUs remain high despite political uncertainty
summary: Chinese tech companies are considering purchasing H200 chips from the black market due to high demand despite Beijing stopping their entry at the border.

title: AMD ROCm CES 2026 press Q&A roundtable transcript
summary: AMD discussed ROCm and how it has evolved significantly since 2023, aiming to break down barriers to AI development.

title: This absurdly fast five-star 540Hz ROG Swift OLED gaming monitor is now available for pre-order
summary: The Asus ROG Swift OLED PG27AQWP-W gaming monitor is now available for pre-order, featuring a 27-inch QHD panel with 1500 nits of peak brightness and a 720Hz mode.

title: 3D-printed fan-less and pump-less liquid cooler can deliver 600 watts of cooling for data centers   passive design provides reusable heat, exceeds project performance expectations by 50%
summary: A 3D-printed passive cooler has been developed to pull 600 W off a datacenter chip, exceeding performance expectations by 50%.

title: Alien fan builds a better Raspberry Pi cyberdeck The MU/TH/UR of all homages to a classic movie series
summary: Jeff Merrick's Raspberry Pi Zero 2W-powered cyberdeck has a 1970/1980s aesthetic, blending the charm of the Alien universe with a powerful single board computer.

title: Elon Musk's xAI Colossus 2 is nowhere near 1 gigawatt capacity, satellite imagery suggests   despite claims, site only has 350 megawatts of cooling capacity
summary: Elon Musk's xAI Colossus 2 has not reached a 1 GW scale, satellite analysis indicates, due to limited cooling capacity.

title: V-Color Manta XFinity RGB DDR5-6400 C32 2x64GB Review: Two-Module Powerhouse
summary: The Manta XFinity RGB DDR5-6400 ranks among the fastest 128GB memory kits available today, but does it truly live up to the hype?

title: Intel axes 12th Gen Alder Lake and 4th Gen Xeon Sapphire Rapids final orders for Intel's first hybrid CPUs end in just a few months
summary: Intel has reached end-of-life status for its 12th Generation Alder Lake and 4th Generation Xeon Sapphire Rapids Scalable processors.

title: FOSDEM 2026 schedule Embedded, RISC-V, Robotics, Rust, Open Hardware, and more
summary: FOSDEM 2026 will take place on January 31-February 1, with thousands of developers meeting in Brussels to discuss open-source software & hardware projects.

title: M5Stack StickS3 ESP32-S3 Mini IoT Dev Kit features 1.14-inch color display, speaker and mic for voice interaction
summary: The M5Stack StickS3 is a miniature ESP32-S3 WiFi and BLE IoT development kit with a 1.14-inch display, speaker, microphone, and improved audio. It's powered by an ESP32-S3 module and features a USB Type-C OTG port, 4-pin Grove connector, and 16-pin female GPIO header for expansion. The kit includes 8MB flash and 8MB PSRAM storage.

title: 3D printed breadboards optimized for Raspberry Pi Pico and ESP32 boards
summary: A user designed 3D printed breadboards that are optimized for Raspberry Pi Pico and ESP32 development boards, leaving space for four rows of components on each side.

title: SpacemiT K3 16-core RISC-V SoC system information and (early) benchmarks
summary: The SpacemiT K3 is a 16-core RISC-V SoC system with up to 2.5 GHz clock speed, based on X100 cores and compliant with RVA23. It has been made available for remote testing, allowing for early system information and benchmark discovery. This testing reveals performance details and capabilities of the system.

title: Raspberry Pi OS adds easier USB gadget mode support
summary: Raspberry Pi OS Trixie now supports USB gadget mode out of the box, streamlining the process and making it easier for users to connect to their Raspberry Pi boards over IP through USB.

title: Advantech MIO-5355 3.5-inch SBC features Qualcomm QCS6490 or QCS5430 SoC for industrial edge AI
summary: Advantech MIO-5355 is a 3.5-inch SBC based on Qualcomm processors, featuring up to 8GB of LPDDR5 memory and supporting industrial deployments with 20 C to 70 C operation.

title: TerraMaster D1 SSD Pro A Thunderbolt 5 fanless SSD enclosure with 80Gbps bandwidth, 7GB/s practical performance
summary: TerraMaster has launched the D1 SSD Pro, a Thunderbolt 5 fanless enclosure with 80Gbps bandwidth, supporting M.2 2280 NVMe SSDs up to 8TB capacity. It features a fanless, CNC-machined aluminum design and offers compatibility with various systems. This enclosure is suited for applications that require real-time editing, ultra-fast transfers, and reliable external storage.

title: Cadence Tensilica HiFi iQ DSP to power next-generation Voice AI and Audio applications
summary: Cadence's Tensilica HiFi iQ DSP offers twice the compute performance, 8x higher AI performance, and more than 25% energy savings compared to its previous generation. It can act as an all-in-one AI processor for voice AI applications. The DSP is designed for next-generation voice AI and immersive audio applications.

title: Geehy G32R430 Arm Cortex-M52 Encoder MCU features Arctangent accelerator, dual 16-bit ADC for industrial motion control systems
summary: Geehy has introduced the G32R430 Arm Cortex-M52 Encoder MCU with a hardware ATAN accelerator, two 16-bit ADCs, and a 40 C to +105 C industrial operating range for high-precision encoder and motion control systems.

title: ESPHome 2026.1.0 optimizes memory usage on ESP32/ESP8266, adds Zigbee support on nRF52, WiFi roaming, and more
summary: The latest ESPHome firmware release features WiFi roaming, Zigbee support, memory optimization for ESP32/ESP8266, and other updates.

title: OnLogic CL260 fanless Intel N150/N250 industrial mini PC offers RS232/RS485 terminal block, 12-24V DC input
summary: The OnLogic CL260 is a fanless industrial mini PC powered by Intel Processor N150 or N250, featuring an RS232/RS485 terminal block, 12-24V DC input, and supports data collection, gateway applications, and edge computing.

title: Arduino UNO Q 4GB board with 4GB RAM, 32GB storage is now available for $59
summary: Arduino has announced the availability of the Arduino UNO Q 4GB with 4GB RAM and 32GB storage for more complex projects.

title: LilyGO T-Display S3 Pro LR1121 devkit adds Sub-GHz and 2.4GHz LoRa, audio support
summary: LilyGO has released the T-Display S3 Pro LR1121, a new ESP32-S3 development kit with sub-GHz and 2.4GHz LoRa connectivity, a touchscreen display, and audio support for applications such as IoT devices and walkie-talkies.

title: M5MonsterC5 hacking tool adds ESP32-C5 and 5 GHz Wi-Fi 6 support to M5Stack Cardputer ADV and Tab5
summary: The M5MonsterC5 is a Marauder hacking tool that connects to M5Stack devices via Grove connector, supporting dual-band Wi-Fi 6 and 802.15.4 for wireless security research and experimentation.

title: Raspberry Pi AI HAT+ 2 review   A 40 TOPS AI accelerator tested with Computer Vision, LLM, and VLM workloads
summary: Raspberry Pi sent a sample of their AI HAT+ 2 generative AI accelerator for review, a 40 TOPS AI accelerator tested for LLM, VLM, and AI vision models.

title: WisMesh 1W Booster Starter Kit targets high-power Meshtastic solutions
summary: The RAKwireless WisMesh 1W Booster Starter Kit is a high-power Meshtastic solution based on Nordic Semiconductor nRF52840, Semtech SX1262, and SKY66122 for extended mesh range. It features a power amplifier, integrated RF filter, and is an alternative to the LILYGO T-Beam 1W. The kit includes a WisBlock RAK3401 Core module and a 1W LoRa transceiver module.

title: Waveshare ESP32-C6-GEEK  A USB flash drive-like ESP32-C6 development board
summary: Waveshare has released the ESP32-C6-GEEK, a USB flash drive-like development board featuring an ESP32-C6 wireless MCU with Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth LE, and Zigbee connectivity, and a 1.14-inch IPS color LCD.

title: EnviroGo ESP32-S3 wearable environmental monitor features 7 sensors (Crowdfunding)
summary: EnviroGo is a wearable environmental monitor that tracks 7 parameters, including VOCs, UV index, and temperature, with built-in Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and a display. It features AI-based prediction and customizable sampling intervals. The device is designed for IoT developers, researchers, and health-conscious individuals.

title: Bedrock RAI300 fanless industrial PC is powered by an AMD Ryzen AI 9 HX 370 mobile AI SoC
summary: The SolidRun Bedrock RAI300 is a fanless industrial PC powered by a 12-core AMD Ryzen AI 9 HX 370 mobile processor, supporting up to 128GB of DDR5 memory and various connectivity options.

title: 2-channel GMSL camera adapter board supports Raspberry Pi 5 and NVIDIA Jetson Orin Nano/NX
summary: Waveshare has released a 2-channel GMSL camera adapter board designed for high-speed, low-latency video transmission on the Raspberry Pi 5 and NVIDIA Jetson Orin Nano/NX developer kits.

title: Witty Pi 5 HAT+   A Raspberry Pi RP2350-based power scheduler with time, temperature, and voltage-based triggers
summary: The Witty Pi 5 HAT+ is a power scheduler board for Raspberry Pi that features scheduled power on/off control with time, temperature, and voltage monitoring.

title: Raspberry Pi CM0-powered low-cost industrial box PCs offer RS-485, 4G LTE, and wide DC input options
summary: EDEC has released the ED-IPC1000 and ED-IPC1100 Raspberry Pi CM0-based industrial box PCs with DIN-rail mounting options, offering standard and advanced connectivity options.

title: Getting started with SONOFF Dongle Plus MG24 Zigbee adapter using Home Assistant
summary: This review covers the unboxing and setup of the SONOFF Dongle Plus MG24 Zigbee adapter, a USB dongle that connects to Home Assistant, allowing users to control Zigbee devices.

title: Tablet-like, ESP32-P4-based 7, 8, and 10.1-inch HMI displays integrate Wi-Fi 6 connectivity, 5MP camera
summary: Waveshare has released a family of ESP32-P4-based HMI display development boards with 7, 8, and 10.1-inch configurations, featuring Wi-Fi 6 connectivity, a 5MP camera, and various I/Os.

title: Jetway P150CDN1 A 15-inch Alder Lake-N fanless industrial panel PC with 8 USB ports for kiosk and HMI
summary: The Jetway P150CDN1 is a 15-inch fanless industrial touch panel PC with a 10-point capacitive touchscreen, ideal for space-constrained or hygiene-sensitive environments. It features a quad-core Alder Lake-N processor, HDMI 2.0 and DP 1.2 video outputs, and 8 USB ports. The device supports wall, panel, and VESA mounting.

title: NanoPC-T6 Plus Rockchip RK3588 SBC switches from LPDDR4x to LPDDR5 (up to 32GB)
summary: The NanoPC-T6 Plus is a variant of the NanoPC-T6 and NanoPC-T6 LTS with an updated Rockchip RK3588 SoC, offering up to 32GB LPDDR5 memory and additional features.

title: XIAO ESP32-C5 A tiny USB-C IoT board with dual-band WiFi 6, Bluetooth 5.0 LE, Zigbee, and Thread connectivity
summary: Seeed Studio has added a new member to its XIAO USB-C board family with the XIAO ESP32-C5, offering dual-band WiFi 6, Bluetooth 5.0 LE, Zigbee, and Thread connectivity. It features a higher clock speed, more memory, and storage compared to its predecessor. The XIAO ESP32-C5 is ideal for IoT projects and products.

title: The End of the AI Toy Era: YouWare Launches YouBase to Deliver Production-Ready Business Tools (Sponsored)
summary: YouWare's YouBase is a production-ready engine that offers a missing link for enterprises looking to leverage AI for full-stack development, overcoming the limitations of AI-coding tools that generate 'digital toys' rather than scalable business tools.

title: ESP32-S3 multi-radio Smart Home gateway features Ethernet, Zigbee, Thread, Z-Wave, Wi-Fi, BLE, and optional 4G LTE connectivity
summary: The SMLIGHT SLZB-Ultima is a multi-radio smart-home gateway with Zigbee, Thread, Z-Wave, Wi-Fi, BLE, and optional 4G LTE connectivity. It features a dual-core ESP32-S3 CPU, built-in buzzer, and 12 WS2812B RGB LEDs for status indication. The device is suitable for an all-in-one smart-home and IoT gateway.

title: Geniatech introduces SMARC and OSM system-on-modules powered by NXP i.MX 95 SoC
summary: Geniatech has released two new System-on-Modules (SoMs) powered by the NXP i.MX 95 Edge AI application processor, designed for smart retail, industrial automation, and commercial IoT.

title: Raspberry Pi AI HAT+ 2 targets generative AI (LLM/VLM) with Hailo-10H accelerator
summary: The Raspberry Pi AI HAT+ 2 brings generative AI capability to Raspberry Pi 5 with the 40 TOPS Hailo-10H AI accelerator, adding support for large language models and vision-language models. It targets applications like offline process control, secure data analysis, and robotics. The board has 8GB of dedicated on-board RAM.

title: reComputer Industrial R2135-12 review A Raspberry Pi CM5-powered fanless Edge AI PC with Hailo-8 AI accelerator
summary: The reComputer AI Industrial R2135-12 is an industrial edge computer built around the Raspberry Pi Compute Module 5 platform, featuring 8 GB LPDDR4 memory, 32 GB eMMC storage, and various I/O options. It's powered by a Hailo-8 AI accelerator and supports AI applications. A demo application showcases real-time people detection and LED matrix visualization.
